reviewText: This is worth buying if your a serious blondie fan. This video compilation includes the complete videos for Heart of Glass, The Tide is High, and Rapture. All the other videos were taken from the greatest hits video compilation. The Heart of Glass audio is in it's original mono version and the original Disco Version (unlike the remixed version on the greatest hits taken from the album version which had horrble audio editing), You won't find this video in this condition anywhere else. The tide is high video is the version they show in clubs featuring stills from the Eat to the Beat videos and a few scenes from the original video. Rapture is complete and the sound on all other videos is 5.1.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have loved Paula Abdul ever since I first heard "Straight Up" on the radio. It was shortly after that I discovered the awesome videos Paula created for her music and which played in unending rotation on MTV. There were two collections of her videos released on VHS in the early 90s but they didn't include all her videos. Paula fans have been desperate to get all of them...too bad it wasn't on this collection either.Not only is it just the six number one videos but they are edited too. For example, in "Straight Up" Arsenio Hall is blurred out in all his appearances and the Lakers logo on her jacket in "Forever Your Girl" is also blurred out. I realize this may be due to rights issues but you would've thought Keanu Reeves would be blurred out of "Rush, Rush". (Luckily he isn't). And speaking of "Rush, Rush", this mini-movie remake of the James Dean classic 'Rebel Without a Cause' is not the full video. It simply begins with the song, rather than the brief scene at first.I had the chance to meet Paula Abdul at a Meet-N-Greet in 2004. She was asked about her music videos being released and she said she was aware that someone was going to release a collection without her permission and she wasn't too happy about that. She also said that she viewed her music videos as art and that she would release her own collection that would present them as they should be. Let's hope that this is soon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, I had owned 2 of Paula Adbul's VHS collection and this DVD has MOST of the videos she has made. There are NO extras on the DVD, but the videos play fine (I was surprised "Cold Hearted" was done in Widescreen/Letterbox). If you're a purist fan of Paula Abdul, you may not want to get this DVD, but it does contain some of her better videos from her first 2 albums.

reviewText: I seldom listen to country music. I don't have anything against it, it's just that I have so many other  things to listen to. However, now and then I'll indulge and I used to watch and enjoy a lot of country videos. I was always favorably impressed by Keith Urban. As such, I was shopping the DVD bargain rack the other day and found the "Keith Urban: Video Hits" DVD. I snapped it up in an instant.First of all, the sound on this DVD is excellent. Well done! I've been watching a number of DVD concerts and the sound was simply awful. This Urban recording is refreshingly good. The video and photography part of this DVD is excellent also. The shots are clear and sharp and well arranged. Mostly, the video is full screen but it has a little widescreen and that's a bit disconcerting, but only in a minor way. Alas, the DVD is only 25 minutes long and I sure would have preferred about an hour or so. I was enjoying it so much and it just seemed cut so short.I'm not terribly fond of this style of video. Let's put it this way, I like to see a band stand and play. I like to watch the musicians interact with one another as they produce their music and I enjoy seeing the audience reaction. In other words, I like more of a conventional concert setting, and there's a bit of this on the Urban DVD. On most of this DVD, however, the music is recorded and then as it is played back Urban and the other characters are shown acting the music out in a variety of settings with abundant lip-syncing and acting out the playing of the musical instruments. Okay, it's a personal preference on my part and I much prefer the concert setting, but let's add that what Urban and company do, they do well. It's enjoyable to watch and it's a well-produced video. All songs are excellent and well done.  I have no personal preferences. Even though I'm not a country fan, I'm pleased to have this video in my library and when a visitor comes over and I play it, I can't imagine them not liking it.Gary Peterson
summary: Good Sound. Good Songs. Well-produced Videos. Enjoy!

reviewText: A FULL length Paula Abdul greatest hits video would be WONDERFUL! Paula still has TONS of old fans from her early solo career, and a whole video collection would be AMAZING!!!These songs are included: 1)Straight Up 2) Forever Your Girl3)Cold Hearted 4) Opposite Attract 5)Rush Rush 6)Promise Of A New DayI was glad to have bought this small collection, and it is pretty cheap as well, but if you have ever bought collections like "Ladies of the 80's" or "Alternative 80's" etc you know that the videos aren't given the 'works' that a record company usually affords for video collections. These are bare bones-just the videos here-no behind the scenes, no extras, but worth it for under $6 to see these videos again, and hope for a full Paula video disc in the future!
summary: Great To See These Gems Again, but....

reviewText: This DVD has only 6 tracks: Heart of Glass, Hanging on the Telephone, Dreaming, Atomic, The Tide is High, and Rapture.You can find these same videos on "Blondie: Greatest Video Hits" 2002 from the label Chrysalis, with 10 additional videos!Or you can find these same videos on "Blondie: Greatest Hits: Sound and Vision" 2006 Capitol Records double CD/DVD package. The DVD has these and 10 additional videos!There is not reason to buy this DVD when you can get this and more on other releases.
summary: 6 tracks of 16 available elsewhere (which you probably have)

reviewText: Paula  abdul finally arrives on dvd..her videos were always full of energy, heart and sensuality..and of course  great dancing and  did i mention.. great music!!...this is a set of some of the most popular of her videos  but its  not the complete set as we are led to believe (where is vibeology..crazy cool, my love is for real, and ..never gonna give you up ?)..i hear that shes working on a personal box set..so that will be worth it  but until that comes out..grab this disc..its a great deal..the dvd menue is superb..and the sound quality is great..although some of the videos are somewhat edited..like the "straight up" video  arsenio hall is  hidden and some of the brand names are blurred out  in her other videos..i guess that was done because of copyright laws etc..yeah its a bit annoying  but what can you do?,,still its great to have these on dvd..because the old vhs tapes were out after time..  im giving  paula 7 stars for her work ..and 4 for the total release
summary: 7 stars to Paula...4 for the  dvd release..still its a good deal

reviewText: Lets not forget that this lady Miss Abdul, is reponsible for carving out Janet jackson image and dance domination in videos, making her one of the most successful stars ever, lets also not forget that Paula's debute album "Forever your Girl" Spawned out 4 #1 Billboarg Pop hits, one of the most successul debute albums ever till this day, her #1 follow up Spellbound did just amazing things too. This DVD shows offers 6 #1 videos, "Straight Up" (the song that made her) great sexy black and white video, paula doing her dance thing (love the opening tap dance section), "Forever you Girl", the playful video where Paula plays the director and cheorapher to kid stars, a joy to watch. "Cold hearted", my favourite of the bunch, the best choereography I have ever seen in a dance/pop song till this day, Paula and her dancers are BRILLIANT. "Opposites Attract" what a memoriable video, Paula Abdul doing her thing with the cartoon Ally cat, absolutely love it. Moving onto her her next CD "Spell bound", the DVD has the beautiful, "Promise of a new Day", a colourful beauty, Paula looking sexy as always and last but not least her #1 ballad "Rush Rush", how I loved this song as a kid, a great video even though there is no dancing. Paula Abdul is a star to remember and I love her, but if they could release a DVD with all her video's including, "The way that you love me", "Knocked out", "Vibeology", "Will u Marry me", "My love is for real" etc, I will be soooo happy, otherwise I just have to be content watching them on YouTube.
summary: LOVE IT 4 STARS BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT ENOUGH VIDEOS
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's nice to see some clips from Blondie, the best of the new wave bands from the late 70's and early 80's.  Blondie was a pioneer in music videos in the days before MTV.  Most of the videos in this compilation are simply shots of the group performing, and the rest are certainly crude and uninspired by today's standards.  But it is a hoot seeing Deborah Harry and the boys in action, and hearing classics like "Heart of Glass" and "The Tide Is High".  The DVD is very short, not much more than thirty minutes.  But it's a lot of fun nonetheless and a must for fans of that bygone era.

reviewText: Well Im giving FIVE STARS to Paula!, not the concept of the collection, it's odd that a collection of an artist who best thing was her unmatchable way to handle her vision of music.  Paula's six videos included here began with STRAIGHT UP her first #1, Paula making that tapping dance at the beginning it's unforgettable, you can tell by her solo dancin' that she knew what she was doin', a classic, como se llama?  a si Mr. Arsenio Hall makes an special appereance, FOREVER YOUR GIRL it's the second vid, it's funny how Paula since the beginning appeal to kids, that's what got into me to be her fan, cos I was a kid by those days, Paula teaching kids, and her in glasses it's just well, good marketing. This was the first thing that FRODO from the Lord Of the rings did for TV and the buzz, COLD HEARTED, my favorite video of it all, based of Bob Fosse Erotica act, it's an incredible video, where Paula stands again as a perfect dancer, check it out, PAULA is dancin' in the same hall as Christina Aguilera's WHAT A GIRL WANTS vid.....all the before videos were directed by now famous art director David Fincher, who has done work like PANIC ROOM, OPPOSITTES ATTRACT, well by 1990 this vid was cool for a kid like me, but know it's just funny, okay still the song made it to #1...take a hint, watch the cat shoes in the TAP sequence, he loses he's shoes color for a while, hummmm...talk about double checking the video before sending it to the TV, RUSH RUSH, amazing vid, i like it, if Paula vids have something in common it's well, they're timeless.  feautering  Mr. Keanu Reeves, and making the video based on Rebel W/O a Cause, it's clever for such a timeless song. THE PROMISE OF A NEW DAY well, now it's seems real to me that the cinematography of this vid was streched to I don't konw why, Paula's looks taller and thinner, but oddly unnatural..but still the dance, the idea and the song rocks, Paula should have hold a Parrot and dance with it, and clap along the dolphins...sorry..but this vid...it's a lil cheesy...I'm with the other fans, well a video including my favorite ones, as MY LOVE IS FOR REAL, CRAZY COOL would be extremely nice!....so...in the mean time, YES this is CHEAP so buy it!...the DVD menu is well done, so two thumbs up to the creators, but to the Marketing team, and whoever decided to release only 6 vids....well hummm...maybe they're palnning to release a second one, with the other six...huh?...*****FIVE STARS to PAULA ABDUL...
